meanings.definition: An object surviving from an earlier time, especially one of historical or sentimental interest.
meanings.sent1: The museum displayed ancient relics from the past.
meanings.sent2: People visit museums to see relics from different time periods.
meanings.sent3: Grandma's old locket became a relic of her youth.
meanings.sent4: The dusty bookshelves held relics of forgotten stories.
meanings.sent5: The relic of the past brought back memories of bygone days.

meanings.definition: A part of a deceased holy person's body or belongings kept as an object of reverence.
meanings.sent1: The church displayed relics of saints for worship.
meanings.sent2: Pilgrims travel far to see relics of revered saints.
meanings.sent3: The relic of the saint's finger was believed to bring blessings.
meanings.sent4: The relic of the holy person's robe symbolized divine protection.
meanings.sent5: The ancient relic of the saint's bone was a sacred treasure.
